historical_suffering_periods.name: Holocaust
historical_suffering_periods.description: Systematic genocide of six million Jews and millions of others by Nazi Germany
historical_suffering_periods.population_affected: Jews, Roma, disabled persons, political prisoners, LGBTQ+ individuals, Slavs
historical_suffering_periods.blessing_focus: All victims of Nazi persecution, survivors and their descendants, healing of collective trauma
historical_suffering_periods.daily_cycle_suggestion: Run blessing cycle from June 22, 1941 to May 8, 1945 (1416 days)

historical_suffering_periods.name: Cambodian Genocide (Khmer Rouge)
historical_suffering_periods.description: Genocide carried out by Khmer Rouge regime under Pol Pot
historical_suffering_periods.population_affected: Cambodian civilians, intellectuals, religious groups, ethnic minorities
historical_suffering_periods.blessing_focus: Victims of Khmer Rouge, survivors bearing trauma, healing of Cambodian people
historical_suffering_periods.daily_cycle_suggestion: Run blessing cycle from April 17, 1975 to January 7, 1979 (1361 days)
mantras: May all beings be free from suffering
visualization_themes: Fields of death becoming fields of life

historical_suffering_periods.name: World War I
historical_suffering_periods.description: The Great War - global conflict with unprecedented casualties
historical_suffering_periods.population_affected: Soldiers from all nations, civilians in war zones, Spanish flu victims
historical_suffering_periods.blessing_focus: All who died in trenches, victims of gas attacks, shell shock survivors, bereaved families
historical_suffering_periods.daily_cycle_suggestion: Run blessing cycle from July 28, 1914 to November 11, 1918 (1567 days)
visualization_themes: No man's land becoming sacred ground

metadata.purpose: Database of historical suffering periods for compassionate blessing and healing work
metadata.usage: These dates and locations can be used with radionics broadcasting, astrocartography, blessing dedications, and time-cycle visualizations
metadata.important_note: This work honors all who suffered. We approach these tragedies with deepest respect, humility, and genuine compassion. May all beings be free from suffering.
metadata.sources: Historical records, memorial sites, academic research, survivor testimonies
metadata.blessing_approach: Non-denominational, inclusive, honoring all traditions and perspectives
